solution_line_template: If Kelly weighs {percent_less}% less than Megan, this means Kelly's weight is {percent_total} - {percent_less} = <<{percent_total}-{percent_less}={kelly_weight_percent_of_megan_num}>>{kelly_weight_percent_of_megan_num}% of Megan's weight.

Mike weighs {mike_weight_more_than_megan} kilograms more than Megan, so he weighs {megan_weight} + {mike_weight_more_than_megan} = <<{megan_weight}+{mike_weight_more_than_megan}={mike_weight}>>{mike_weight} kilograms.
In total all three kids weigh {kelly_weight} + {megan_weight} + {mike_weight} = <<{kelly_weight}+{megan_weight}+{mike_weight}={total_children_weight}>>{total_children_weight} kilograms.
That means to cross the bridge safely, they weigh {total_children_weight} - {bridge_capacity} = <<{total_children_weight}-{bridge_capacity}={excess_weight}>>{excess_weight} kilograms too much.
